Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualC.dll is an obsolete assembly and exists only for backwards compatibility.")

Docs.summary: An attribute used by the compiler to pass the decorated name of a method to the linker.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The decorated name of a method incorporates information about the method's parameter types.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The decorated name of a method.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified decorated name.
